alert.note: Alert for Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 9:35PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Williamson County through 1015 PM CDT... At 934 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Rockdale to near Thorndale to near Thrall to near Taylor. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Taylor, Hutto, Thrall, Coupland, Beyarsville and Noack. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central Texas.
